g.title: Global
g.text: Note: Not recruited heroes (such as in tavern)
are not attached to any node
Contains global bonuses, global stack experience and difficulty bonuses

g.title: Team
g.text: Game will put players without team
into a team with a single player

g.title: Neutral Army
g.text: Any army that is not owned by a player

g.title: Player
g.text: All objects owned by a player

g.title: Wandering Hero
g.text: moving on map, outside of towns

g.title: Owned Object
g.text: Other objects owned by a player, like Lighthouse

g.title: Town and visiting hero
g.text: to propagate bonuses to both town and visiting hero
Note: Neutral towns are attached to global node instead

g.title: Hero
g.text: Represents a hero, either owned by player or in prison.
Bonuses from specialty and secondary skills
are attached directly to this node
Contains per-hero global bonuses, specialty bonuses,
primary and secondary skill bonuses, campaign primary skill bonus

g.title: Army
g.text: Represents any object that can hold army,
such as town, hero, mines, garrisons, wandering monsters
Contain anti-magic garrison bonus, faction mixing morale bonus

g.title: Combat
g.text: Node that contains both sides of a combat
Anything propagated to this node will affect both sides in combat
Contains battlefield and native terrain bonuses

g.title: Garrisoned Hero
g.text: placed in a garrison of owned town

g.title: Artifact Instance
g.text: Represents a particular instance of an artifact
that hero can equip or trade
Contains bonuses of spell scrolls and growing artifacts

g.title: Boat
g.text: Represents a boat or other type of transport.
Contains bonuses provided to boarded hero

g.title: Creature Type
g.text: Represents a creature type, such as Pikeman or Archer
Contains creature abilities bonuses, stack experience bonuses

g.title: Unit in Army
g.text: Represents a unit that is part of a army
A unit always has a creature type,
belongs to an army and has stack size

g.title: Commander
g.text: Represents a hero commander, WoG feature

g.title: Summon in Combat
g.text: Represents any unit that was added in combat,
and may not remain after combat

g.title: Artifact Type
g.text: Represents an artifact type, for example Ring of Life

g.title: Artifact Component
g.text: instances of components are attached to instance of combined artifact

g.title: Unit in Combat
g.text: Represents current state of a unit during combat,
can be affected by spells or receive damage
